etymology.description: pictogram: agricultural weeding/tilling tool; possibly made from large clam 蜃; alt. person holding a cliff (proto-振).
etymology.interpretation: Early forms likely depict a farm tool for weeding and tilling, perhaps fashioned from a large clam shell (蜃), which helps explain later associations with times of work like morning and its role as the 5th Earthly Branch. An alternative view sees a person bracing against a cliff, a sense preserved in 振, but the graph was ultimately borrowed for calendrical timekeeping.

examples.chinese: 我们在辰时出发(我們在辰時出發)。
examples.english: We set out at the chén hour.

examples.chinese: 选在良辰吉日动工(選在良辰吉日動工)。
examples.pinyin: Xuǎn zài liángchén jí rì dònggōng.
examples.english: Choose an auspicious time and day to start work.

examples.chinese: 今年是甲辰年(今年是甲辰年)。
examples.english: This year is the Jiǎchén year.
